intro: Eschscholzia angularis, commonly known as the angular poppy, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its striking red to orange flowers and hairy, angular leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its flowers bloom in the spring and are visited by various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Eschscholzia angularis is a member of the Papaveraceae family, which includes other well-known poppy species.
